page.title: 19RELIGION
page.content: Mr. Peter Elvy the vicar of Great Burstead church was a journalist before he was ordained. He began working for Essex Radio four years ago. He has two jobs, one as community -co-ordinator,the other as chaplain.He helped to raise Â£40 000 which was spent on four mini-buses. He is in charge of the religious output of the station, organising two "Morning Reflections" daily.These last one minute and are given by various people to make a "quiet space" in a busy day On Sunday evening he broadcasts Life- line. People can phone and discuss problems and advice is given.As chaplain he marries members of Essex Radio staff and baptises them too.On one sad occasion, he buried one of the staff and comforted the family.
